title: kernel die
body:
Hi, I have a small dataset which can be trained without problem with any of the combinations of the params separately, but when I try to scan it the kernel it's dieing. I'm trying with all the combinations of keras and tensorflow GPU configs but no one it's working. My dataset is "Train on 3204 samples, validate on 802 samples", and the model summary is like this:
```
Layer (type)                 Output Shape              Param #   
=================================================================
embedding_1 (Embedding)      (None, 50, 1000)          3419000   
_________________________________________________________________
conv1d_1 (Conv1D)            (None, 50, 128)           640128    
_________________________________________________________________
dropout_1 (Dropout)          (None, 50, 128)           0         
_________________________________________________________________
lstm_1 (LSTM)                (None, 50, 100)           91600     
_________________________________________________________________
attention_tf_1 (Attention_tf (None, 100)               150       
_________________________________________________________________
dropout_2 (Dropout)          (None, 100)               0         
_________________________________________________________________
dense_1 (Dense)              (None, 18)                1818      
=================================================================
```
my params are: 
```
p = {'lr': (0.5, 5, 10),
     'lstm_size':[500,200,100],
     'conv1_size': [256,128,64],
     'cn_shape':[5],
     'batch_size': (50, 51, 100),
     'epochs': [1],
     'dropout': (0, 0.5, 1),
     'embeding_size': [1000,10000],
     'optimizer': [Adam],
     'losses': [categorical_crossentropy, binary_crossentropy],
     'activation':[relu, elu],
     'last_activation': [softmax]}
```
I'm with a Geforce GTX 1080 ti, keras==2.2.4, tensorflow==1.8 and talos 0.4.6.  Any help please?

**EDIT**
Solved after upgrade to tensorflow 1.11. Sorry!
